Rules Engine

Taking action one criterion at a time

    Technologies

    Programming Languages

    • Java: powers the backend engine, evaluating the criteria set against received data and executing actions when a rule is deemed applicable
    • Python: serves the frontend interface to the user who manages the rule set
    • JavaScript: creates a dynamic frontend experience, updating portions of the web page in response to user actions
    • Shell Scripting: automate tedious developer tasks and ensure Docker containers run securely and consistently

    Environment

    • Docker: containers host the frontend, backend, and supporting services, while Docker Compose orchestrates the containers into a functioning system.
    • MySQL: database server that stores the ruleset, which is managed by the frontend and used by the backend.
    • nginx: an HTTP proxy server delivering static content for the frontend and providing access to the frontend application container.
    • Gunicorn: a web server gateway interface (WSGI) providing communication between the nginx proxy server and the Django frontend application
    • GreenMail: an email platform, providing a window to view the final outcome of the engine’s evaluation when applicable.
    • WildFly: Java application server that runs the backend application

    Frameworks and Tools

    • Jakarta EE: Java framework specifications for dependency injection, REST services, and email
    • Maven: project management tool used to build the backend
    • JUnit 5: Java testing framework
    • Mockito: mocking framework for Java unit tests
    • Testcontainers: provides a MySQL instance for testing the frontend consistently and provides the environment for the backend integration tests
    • Django: web framework powering the frontend, collecting input from the user and updating the database as needed
    • Selenium: automates frontend testing of the user interface via a web browser
    • Bootstrap: styles the frontend web pages via Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), ensuring a consistent layout and appearance regardless of the user’s web browser
    • requests-mock: transport adapter used during frontend testing to mock the backend REST API
